trans-unit.source: Gets role information for an ASP.NET application from Windows group membership.
The <xref:System.Web.Security.WindowsTokenRoleProvider> class is a read-only role-membership provider that retrieves role information for a Windows user based on Windows security groups.
It is most useful with ASP.NET applications that use Windows authentication mode where the IIS authentication settings disable anonymous authentication.
You can configure ASP.NET applications to allow or deny access based on a user's membership in a particular Windows group.
You cannot use the <xref:System.Web.Security.WindowsTokenRoleProvider> class to create or delete roles or modify the membership of a role that is based on Windows group membership.
This functionality is managed by the Windows operating system.

The <xref:System.Web.Security.WindowsTokenRoleProvider> class supports only the <xref:System.Web.Security.WindowsTokenRoleProvider.IsUserInRole%2A> and <xref:System.Web.Security.WindowsTokenRoleProvider.GetRolesForUser%2A> methods of the <xref:System.Web.Security.RoleProvider> abstract class.
Creates an instance of the <xref href="System.Web.Security.WindowsTokenRoleProvider"></xref> class.

The <xref:System.Web.Security.WindowsTokenRoleProvider.%23ctor%2A> constructor is called by ASP.NET to create an instance of the <xref:System.Web.Security.WindowsTokenRoleProvider> class as specified in the configuration for the application.
This constructor is not intended to be used from your code.
This method is not supported by the Windows token role provider.
This method is not supported by the <xref:System.Web.Security.WindowsTokenRoleProvider> class and always throws a <xref:System.Configuration.Provider.ProviderException>.
A string array of user names to be added to the specified roles.
A string array of role names to add the specified user names to.
An unsupported method was called.
Gets or sets the name of the application.

Unlike other role providers such as the <xref:System.Web.Security.SqlRoleProvider>, the <xref:System.Web.Security.WindowsTokenRoleProvider> class does not associate role information with an application.
Instead, the role information is taken from the Windows groups on the local computer.
Multiple applications on the same server that use the <xref:System.Web.Security.WindowsTokenRoleProvider> class always share the same role information.

Although the `applicationName` can be configured in the Web.config file for the application, the <xref:System.Web.Security.WindowsTokenRoleProvider.ApplicationName%2A> property is not used to retrieve role information.
The name of the application.

An attempt was made to set the <xref href="System.Web.Security.WindowsTokenRoleProvider.ApplicationName"></xref> property by a caller that does not have <xref href="System.Web.AspNetHostingPermissionLevel.High"></xref> ASP.NET hosting permission.
An attempt was made to set the <xref href="System.Web.Security.WindowsTokenRoleProvider.ApplicationName"></xref> to a string that is longer than 256 characters.
This method is not supported by the Windows token role provider.
This method is not supported by the <xref:System.Web.Security.WindowsTokenRoleProvider> class and always throws a <xref:System.Configuration.Provider.ProviderException>.
The name of the role to create.
An unsupported method was called.
This method is not supported by the Windows token role provider.
The name of the role to delete.
If `true`, an exception will be thrown on an attempt to delete a role that contains one or more members.
None.
The method is not supported by the <xref href="System.Web.Security.WindowsTokenRoleProvider"></xref> class and always throws a <xref href="System.Configuration.Provider.ProviderException"></xref>.
An unsupported method was called.
This method is not supported by the Windows token role provider.
The role to search in.
The user name to find in the role.
None.
The method is not supported by the <xref href="System.Web.Security.WindowsTokenRoleProvider"></xref> class and always throws a <xref href="System.Configuration.Provider.ProviderException"></xref>.
An unsupported method was called.
This method is not supported by the Windows token role provider.
None.
The method is not supported by the <xref href="System.Web.Security.WindowsTokenRoleProvider"></xref> class and always throws a <xref href="System.Configuration.Provider.ProviderException"></xref>.
An unsupported method was called.
Gets a list of the Windows groups that a user is in.
This method is called by the <xref:System.Web.Security.Roles> class to retrieve from the Windows operating system a list of the Windows groups that the specified user is in.
The <xref:System.Web.Security.WindowsTokenRoleProvider.GetRolesForUser%2A> method can be called only for the currently logged-on user, as identified by the LOGON_USER server variable.
If the value supplied in the `username` parameter is not the name of the currently logged-on user, a <xref:System.Configuration.Provider.ProviderException?displayProperty=fullName> is thrown.
For more information an ASP.NET and Windows authentication, see [ASP.NET Authentication](http://msdn.microsoft.com/library/fc10b0ef-4ce4-4a7f-9174-886325221ee1).
The user to return the list of Windows groups for in the form DOMAIN\username.
A string array containing the names of all the Windows groups that the specified user is in.
The currently executing user does not have an authenticated <xref href="System.Security.Principal.WindowsIdentity"></xref> attached to <xref href="System.Web.UI.Page.User"></xref>.

For non-HTTP scenarios, the currently executing user does not have an authenticated <xref href="System.Security.Principal.WindowsIdentity"></xref> attached to <xref href="System.Threading.Thread.CurrentPrincipal"></xref>.
-or-
username does not match the of the current .
-or-
A failure occurred while retrieving the user's Windows group information.
username is `null`.
The trust level is less than <xref href="System.Web.AspNetHostingPermissionLevel.Low"></xref>.
This method is not supported by the Windows token role provider.
The name of the role to get the list of users for.
None.
The method is not supported by the <xref href="System.Web.Security.WindowsTokenRoleProvider"></xref> class and always throws a <xref href="System.Configuration.Provider.ProviderException"></xref>.
An unsupported method was called.
Initializes the Windows token role provider with the property values specified in the configuration file for the ASP.NET application.
This method is not intended to be used directly from your code.

The <xref:System.Web.Security.WindowsTokenRoleProvider.Initialize%2A> method initializes the <xref:System.Web.Security.WindowsTokenRoleProvider> class with the property values specified in the ASP.NET application configuration file (Web.config) and is not intended to be used directly from your code.
The name of the <xref href="System.Web.Security.WindowsTokenRoleProvider"></xref> instance to initialize.

A <xref href="System.Collections.Specialized.NameValueCollection"></xref> constructor that contains the names and values of configuration options for the <xref href="System.Web.Security.WindowsTokenRoleProvider"></xref> class.
config is `null`.
The `applicationName` attribute in the configuration is longer than 256 characters.
-or-
The application configuration file for this <xref href="System.Web.Security.WindowsTokenRoleProvider"></xref> instance contains an unrecognized attribute.
Gets a value indicating whether the specified user is in the specified built-in Windows role.

The <xref:System.Web.Security.WindowsTokenRoleProvider.IsUserInRole%2A> method enables you to check whether a user is in one of the common Windows roles described by the <xref:System.Security.Principal.WindowsBuiltInRole> enumeration.
This method is useful for applications that are localized into multiple languages.

This overload of the <xref:System.Web.Security.WindowsTokenRoleProvider.IsUserInRole%2A> method is not part of the <xref:System.Web.Security.RoleProvider> base class and can only be accessed by casting the <xref:System.Web.Security.Roles.Provider%2A> property of the <xref:System.Web.Security.Roles> class as the <xref:System.Web.Security.WindowsTokenRoleProvider> type.
You can call the <xref:System.Web.Security.WindowsTokenRoleProvider.IsUserInRole%2A> method only for the currently logged-on user, as identified by the LOGON_USER server variable.
If the value supplied in the `username` parameter is not the name of the currently logged-on user, an <xref:System.Web.HttpException> is thrown.
<xref:System.Web.Security.WindowsTokenRoleProvider.IsUserInRole%2A> method can only be called for the currently logged-on user identified by the LOGON_USER server variable.
The current logged on user must be a Windows authenticated user.
For more information on ASP.NET and Windows authentication, see [ASP.NET Authentication](http://msdn.microsoft.com/library/fc10b0ef-4ce4-4a7f-9174-886325221ee1).
The user name to search for in the form DOMAIN\username.
The Windows role to search in.
`true` if the specified user is in the specified Windows role; otherwise, `false`.
username is `null`.
The currently executing user does not have an authenticated <xref href="System.Security.Principal.WindowsIdentity"></xref> attached to <xref href="System.Web.UI.Page.User"></xref>.

For non-HTTP scenarios, the currently executing user does not have an authenticated <xref href="System.Security.Principal.WindowsIdentity"></xref> attached to <xref href="System.Threading.Thread.CurrentPrincipal"></xref>.
-or-
username does not match the of the current .
Gets a value indicating whether the specified user is in the specified Windows group.

The <xref:System.Web.Security.WindowsTokenRoleProvider.IsUserInRole%2A> method is called by the <xref:System.Web.Security.Roles> class and the <xref:System.Security.Principal.IPrincipal.IsInRole%2A> method of the <xref:System.Web.UI.Page.User%2A> property to determine whether a user is in a Windows group.
You can call the <xref:System.Web.Security.WindowsTokenRoleProvider.IsUserInRole%2A> method only for the currently logged-on user, as identified by the LOGON_USER server variable.
The current logged-on user must be a Windows authenticated user.
For more information on ASP.NET and Windows authentication, see [ASP.NET Authentication](http://msdn.microsoft.com/library/fc10b0ef-4ce4-4a7f-9174-886325221ee1).
The user name to search for in the form DOMAIN\username.
The Windows group to search in the form DOMAIN\rolename.
`true` if the specified user name is in the specified Windows group; otherwise, `false`.
username is `null`.
-or-
roleName is `null`.
The currently executing user does not have an authenticated <xref href="System.Security.Principal.WindowsIdentity"></xref> attached to <xref href="System.Web.UI.Page.User"></xref>.

For non-HTTP scenarios, the currently executing user does not have an authenticated <xref href="System.Security.Principal.WindowsIdentity"></xref> attached to <xref href="System.Threading.Thread.CurrentPrincipal"></xref>.
-or-
username does not match the of the current .
-or-
A failure occurred while retrieving the user's Windows group information.
This method is not supported by the Windows token role provider.
This method is not supported by the <xref:System.Web.Security.WindowsTokenRoleProvider> class and always throws a <xref:System.Configuration.Provider.ProviderException>.
A string array of user names to be added to the specified roles.
A string array of role names to add the specified user names to.
An unsupported method was called.
This method is not supported by the Windows token role provider.
The name of the role to search for in the data source.
None.
The method is not supported by the <xref href="System.Web.Security.WindowsTokenRoleProvider"></xref> class and always throws a <xref href="System.Configuration.Provider.ProviderException"></xref>.
An unsupported method was called.
